snippet: The rial has fallen in value by about 40 percent over the past week, battered by economic sanctions and new anxieties among Iranians about their government.
abstract: Iranian rial has fallen in value by about 40 percent in a week, battered by combination of potent Western sanctions over the disputed Iranian nuclear program and new anxieties among Iranians about their government's economic stewardship.
lead_paragraph: The rial has fallen in value by about 40 percent over the past week, battered by economic sanctions and new anxieties among Iranians about their government.

headline.seo: Iran’s Rial Plummets Against the Dollar
headline.main: A New Sign of Distress as Iran’s Currency Falls
headline.print_headline: A New Sign Of Distress As Currency In Iran Falls
